question: I  wake up several times a month with chest pressure, sometimes palipitations,  malaise ,and lately inability to take a deep breath during early morning(4-6 a.m. Once, in a hospital at this time, I was given oxygen, which immediately relieved symptons. Needless to say , I was shocked at my relief. Unfortunately, the drs weren't interested in this  occurance, because my stress nuclear test and ekg were normal they said.Has anyone experienced chest discomfort like this? Has anyone with diabetes experienced chest pressure or malaise  early morning hours?
title: morning chest pain-diabetes?
